intro: Richella obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved richella, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky outcrops, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Richella obtusata is notable for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid environments.
